intro: Marsdenia cundurango, commonly known as the Cundurango vine, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and fleshy, tuberous roots. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features include opposite, ovate leaves and a distinctive milky sap. Marsdenia cundurango is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local medicine.
